criteria: Understanding of Family Dynamics and Functions
descriptions: Does not identify any family structures.
Identifies only one family structure with significant inaccuracies.
Identifies 1 to 2 common family structures (e.g., nuclear, single-parent) with minor inaccuracies.
Identifies 2 to 3 common family structures accurately and provides basic definitions.
Identifies 3 to 4 diverse family structures (e.g., blended, extended, adoptive) accurately, including definitions.
Identifies multiple diverse family structures accurately, provides comprehensive definitions, and recognizes variations within them.
Unable to describe any characteristics of families.
Describes one characteristic vaguely or inaccurately.
Describes 1-2 characteristics (e.g., roles, responsibilities, values) with limited detail.
Describes 2-3 characteristics of families with some explanation and examples.
Describes 3-4 key characteristics of families, explaining their significance and providing relevant examples.
Provides a thorough description of multiple characteristics of families, analyzing their importance and illustrating with insightful examples.
Demonstrates no understanding of family dynamics or functions.
Shows a minimal understanding of family dynamics.
Identifies at least one function of families (e.g., support, socialization) with limited explanation.
Describes 1 to 2 functions of families and their roles in society.
Explains multiple functions of families and analyzes how they contribute to individual and societal well-being.
Demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of family dynamics and functions, including their impact on individual development and cultural transmission.
